reporting-org.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs

title.narrative: Winterization and Flood Protection for Most Vulnerable Men, Women, Boys and Girls in Afrin and Maaret Tamsrin.

description.narrative: The project aims at providing shelter and NFI services to enhance protection from floods, harsh winter impact and promote safe and dignified living conditions for 7150 Households (HHs) through two components: In the shelter components, the project will provide critical improvement to infrastructure in three IDP sites, about 550 HHs roughly 3200 men, women, boys and girls, who suffered from floods last year, including tent ground leveling, drainage channels and road maintenance in order to mitigate the impact of weather conditions, prevent flooding and facilitate access to shelter, WASH facilities and other services in the camp to ensure better protected and dignified living conditions. In the winterization components, the project will cover the winter needs of 6600 HHs, (85% IDPs and only 15% host community because in these areas the vast majority are IDPs), with a total of 33000 people (6270 men, 6764 women, 9900 boys, and 10066 girls, in a flexible manner (cash assistance), so that each family can select the items they need for three months. In accordance with cluster guidelines, the value of the cash assistance will be $150 for each family, which will enable the family to buy fuel (diesel, coal or Pomace/olive- pit biomass) for three months in addition to the needed jerrycans, heaters and accessories in the first month. Locations were selected according to the needs assessment conducted by our MampE team and in accordance with the allocation strategy’s objectives. Thus, 9 underserved communities (Baee, Basufan, Burj Haydar, Kabashin, Fafertein, Afrin (the center), Qarzihel , Kawkabeh and Bablit) within Afrin sub-district, Aleppo governorate, will be targeted in this intervention. Financial service providers (FSP) will be contracted to conduct the cash distribution process in order to mitigate the risks related to cash distribution. Training on PSEA and GBV and induction about covid19 and project mechanism will be provided to both SDI staff, providers of both shelter and NFI components, and their related staff in the beginning of the project. The project will aim to hire local staff from both genders thus provide job opportunities for both male and female individuals and contribute to enhancing the local market and operating local businesses. The selection of beneficiaries will ensure gender mainstreaming and reaching PWDs. The project will also focus on community participation and the benefit of all social groups within the community (women, elderly, youth, children and disabled, etc.). To ensure protection and accountability, awareness on covid19, PSEA, complaint mechanism and fire prevention will be provided to all beneficiaries.

owner-org.narrative: United Nations OCHA Financial Tracking Service (UN OCHA FTS)
